definition: (after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Lancers and dancers pass a poisoned syringe.
sentences.chinese: 槍騎兵和舞者經過一次被投毒的注射。

sentences.english: Yes, kind of. I think all DJs are also dancers.
sentences.chinese: 某種程度上是的，我想所有的DJ都是舞者。

sentences.english: It's said that the first Galliard was a Fianna.
sentences.chinese: 有人說最早的歡舞者是一個芬尼安。

sentences.english: Madrid, a city of night-walking dancers and day-drinking scholars. A city of pleasure and pain.
sentences.chinese: 馬德里，舞者夜行文人晝飲之痛並快樂城市。

sentences.english: The dancer took everybody at the performance by storm.
sentences.chinese: 這名舞者的表演擄獲每個人的心。

sentences.english: Emily hopes to carry out her dream to be a ballerina.
sentences.chinese: 愛蜜莉希望能實現當芭蕾舞者夢想。

sentences.english: And what is the advantage your puppets would have over living dancers?
sentences.chinese: 而相較於活的舞者你的木偶的優勢又是什麼呢？

sentences.english: She watched them swim around the boat. They were as graceful as dancers.
sentences.chinese: 她看着它們在船邊游來游去，動作就像舞者一樣優雅。

sentences.english: Siamese dancers strike a pose in a temple courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 暹羅舞者在一座寺廟的庭院前擺出姿勢以供拍攝。

sentences.english: A warm-up show by a group of dancers and Pun in Oil Street Art Village.
sentences.chinese: 一個由潘德恕和一羣舞者在藝術村的熱身表演。

sentences.english: The fire spread rapidly after the fire dancer ignited the ceiling decoration by accident.
sentences.chinese: 火舞舞者不小心引燃天花板裝潢後，大火迅速蔓延。

sentences.english: Zuleika grabs Josh's hand and pulls him into the circle of dancers.
sentences.chinese: 奈提莉抓住傑克的手，把他拉到舞者中間。

sentences.english: The dancing was a bit straggly in the " London " routine .
sentences.chinese: 倫敦的例行表演中登場的那些舞者簡直就是羣醜跳梁。

sentences.english: The dancers alternately _arched_ and hunched their backs.
sentences.chinese: 舞者們交替的彎成弓型，隆起他們的背。

sentences.english: Damian:Bollywood is really unique with its troops of dancers and vivid colors.
sentences.chinese: 成羣的舞者，飽滿的顏色，寶萊塢真的很有特色。

sentences.english: You do not have to be a professional dancer to mount an excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 你沒有必要成爲一個專業的舞者登上優美表演的頂峯。

definition: to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
